bibdata.title: Refactor the LocationMapsGeneratorService so that we don't take an extra label in the locations template

comments.body:
My current solution that I have also confirmed with @kevinreiss and @mzelesky is:

-  To remove the redundant first library label and keep only the location label that we retrieve from Alma. 
This means that in the orangelight search results page we will display "Architecture Library - Architecture New Book Shelf" vs "Architecture Library - Architecture Library - Architecture New Book Shelf".
- In some of the $stacks locations the location label is the same as the library label. This is not consistent though. In this case I will remove the duplicate string/label for any $stacks locations that carry the same label as the library. 
For example in the case of "firestone$stacks", we will display in orangelight "Firestone Library" vs "Firestone Library - Firestone Library".

This solution will result in the same orangelight UI as what we have now in production.

The redundant first string for 'Lewis Library' has been removed. and will remove the $stacks label when it is the same as the library label. 
The example in the snaphost is what I described in the previous comment for 'Firestone Library'

![example_ol](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/110975333-9ca8b080-832d-11eb-851a-12877acc0b76.png)

bibdata.title: Remove extra library label from locations

comments.body: For context here is what the configuration on the shelf location ranges looks like in the locater app: After looking over the code again, it appears that treatment of oversize books kicks in when the call number ends in "q", this behavior happens only for the existing "f" holding location which will become firestone$stacks in Alma. example: https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/4159851 https://github.com/pulibrary/firestone_locator/blob/00ad7b643305ea055bee34cd717446aa950bb399/includes/item_proc.php#L163 https://github.com/pulibrary/firestone_locator/blob/00ad7b643305ea055bee34cd717446aa950bb399/includes/item_proc.php#L263

dpul.title: Add date range rendering to show pages

comments.body:
I checked the exhibits to see which ones are displaying this field and there are only 4 including the 2 mentioned here. I will just click the reindex button for the other 2.

```
> exhibits = Spotlight::Exhibit.all.to_a
> selected = exhibits.select { |e| (e.blacklight_config.show_fields.select { |a| a == "readonly_date-range_ssim" }).present? }
> selected.map { |e| [e.id, e.slug] }
=> [[71, "sae_sri_lanka_dissidents"], [70, "cuba-tourism"], [15, "slavic"], [46, "sae"]]
```
reindexing is done.

dspace-development.title: Home button is broken in Data Space
Add Community, Collection, and Issue Date to empty filenames report

comments.body:
Maybe I should start making gists of these for safe keeping

```sql
SELECT (
    SELECT text_value as community_name
    FROM metadatavalue
    WHERE resource_type_id = 4 AND resource_id = community_id AND metadata_field_id = 64
),(
    SELECT text_value as collection_name
    FROM metadatavalue 
    WHERE resource_type_id = 3 AND resource_id = community2collection.collection_id AND metadata_field_id = 64
),handle,bitstream_id
FROM handle 
INNER JOIN item ON (item.item_id = handle.resource_id)
INNER JOIN item2bundle ON (item.item_id = item2bundle.item_id)
INNER JOIN bundle2bitstream ON (item2bundle.bundle_id = bundle2bitstream.bundle_id)
INNER JOIN collection2item on collection2item.item_id = item.item_id
INNER JOIN community2collection on community2collection.collection_id = collection2item.collection_id
WHERE bitstream_id IN (
    SELECT resource_id
    FROM metadatavalue WHERE resource_type_id = 0 
    GROUP BY resource_id 
    HAVING NOT (64 = ANY(ARRAY_AGG(metadata_field_id)))
);

```

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LhDt9ppgX_Q3uCqKhr3HZieLq12-Up1DlmQW5JrjxF8/edit#gid=0

This spreadsheet has been updated

lib_jobs.title: Update the README by specifying the staging ASpace server and repository, resources, and topcontainers

comments.body:
## account_controller#index

First fetches patron "first_name", "last_name", "barcode" from bibdata using the netit.

Then it hits voyager to get the account object with the following properties:
- avail_items has keys:
  - itemID
  - itemTitle
  - expireDate
  - pickuplocation
  - in helper:
    - holdRecallID
    - holdType
- request_items has keys:
  - itemID
  - itemTitle
  - expireDate
  - pickuplocation
  - queuePosition
  - in helper:
    - holdRecallID
    - holdType
- fines_fees has keys:
  - date
  - title
  - postingType
  - amount
  - balance
  - there's a total but it's just accessed as "last"?
- charged_items has keys:
  - itemId
  - renewable
  - title
  - dueDate
  - in helper:
    - renew_status
    - callNumber
    - locationCode
    - statusCode
    - [:messages]['message']
    - [:renew_status]['status']
- borrowing_blocks has keys:
  - patronGroupName
  - blockCount
  - blockReason

- request cancel endpoint takes request_id and returns `204 No Content` on success.
- renew loan takes loan_id and returns the loan object

pulfalight.title: Search results/relevancy still need some tweaking

comments.body:
We made the decision in Pulfalight to weight titles more heavily, meaning exact matches for "Gest Library" in the title will float to the top. Closing this ticket would require weighting series higher than everything else as long as there's any match at all, potentially pushing out good component matches. As such, we're going to mark this #wontfix.

For reference, the only reference to Gest Library in that series is the description. Searching for "Gest Library Records" actually makes Series 17 show up as the third result, and searching for "East Asian Library Records" results in it being the first result.
